result.execSummary:
The court found certain circumstances that required this case be transferred to the jurisdiction of the Juvenile Court. When a juvenile is charged in a court of criminal jurisdiction, the court can transfer the case to the jurisdiction of the juvenile court if the court finds all of the following: 1) If convicted, the juvenile could not receive adequate treatment in the criminal justice system; 2) Transferring jurisdiction to the court assigned to exercise juvenile jurisdiction would not depreciate the seriousness of the offense; and 3) Retaining jurisdiction is not necessary to deter the juvenile or other juveniles from committing the violation of which the juvenile is accused.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elleonna L. Butler

records.addlTxt:
Case Called: 2:13 pm
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher in person. Defendant appears via Zoom Video and with Atty Peter Vu in person.
VRCW.
Date and time set for a Reverse Waiver to Juvenile Court; 
Defense to Waive the Preliminary Hearing and then parties are to address the Reverse Waiver which is stipulated to. 

Waiver of Prelim. filed.  
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information to be E-filed.  Reading Waived.

Parties state the Stipulations on the record regarding the Reverse Waiver.
COURT makes findings. Court Finds Defense has met their burden.
COURT Grants Reverse Waiver into Juvenile Court.

**COURTROOM IS NOW CLOSED**

Adj: 2:25 pm
Re: Original Adult Court Jurisdiction Order
Notice of Motion and Motion to Request a Reverse Waiver Hearing
Reverse Waiver to be done on 2/16/2022
Review Hearing 01/28 @ 1:00 pm, Pretrial Conference 02/09 @ 10:30 am, Preliminary Hearing 02/16 @ 2:05 pm, Plea Hearing 04/25 @ 3:00 pm. Return to Sender/No Mail Receptacle
